1.verse: The Unfaithful Wife - The word of ADONAI that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam son of Joash, king of Israel.

2.verse: When ADONAI first spoke with Hosea, ADONAI said to Hosea: “Go, get yourself a prostitute as a wife and children with a prostitute! For the land is an unfaithful prostitute, far from following after ADONAI.”

3.verse: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.

4.verse: Then ADONAI said to him: “Name him Jezreel for in yet a little while I will visit the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu, and I will destroy the kingdom of the house of Israel.

5.verse: In that day I will break the bow of Israel in the valley of Jezreel.”

6.verse: Then she conceived again, and bore a daughter. And He said to him: “Name her Lo-ruhamah— for no longer will I have compassion on the house of Israel that I should ever pardon them.

7.verse: But on the house of Judah I will have compassion and deliver them by ADONAI, their God, yet not by bow, sword or battle, nor by horses and horsemen.”

8.verse: After she weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.

9.verse: Then He said: “Name him Lo-ammi, for you are not My people and I am not yours.”

1.verse: Restoring the Covenant Promises - “Yet the number of Bnei-Yisrael will be like the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured or counted. Instead of ‘You are not My people’ being said to them, they will be called ‘Children of the living God.’

2.verse: Then the descendants of Judah and descendants of Israel will be gathered together. They will appoint themselves one head And they will go up from the land. For the day of Jezreel will be great.

3.verse: Say you to your brothers, ‘Ammi’ and to your sisters, ‘Ruhamah’.

4.verse: Contend with your mother, contend! For she is not My wife nor I her husband. Let her put away her fornications from her face and her adulteries from between her breasts.

5.verse: Or else I will strip her naked and expose her as on the day she was born. Then I will make her like a wilderness. Yes, I will make her like desert land, and I will let her die of thirst.

6.verse: I will have no compassion for her children, for they are children of prostitution.

7.verse: For their mother has practiced prostitution. She who conceived them has been shameful. For she said, ‘Let me go after my lovers, who are giving me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.’

8.verse: Therefore see, I will hedge her in with thorns, and I will build a wall around her so she cannot find her paths.

9.verse: Then she will chase after her lovers, but she will not overtake them. She will seek them, but not find. Then she will say: ‘Let me go and return to my first husband, for was it better for me then, than now.’

10.verse: But she did not realize that I Myself gave her the grain, the wine and the fresh oil. I lavished on her silver, also gold— which they made into Baal.

11.verse: Therefore I will return and take back My grain in its season, and My new wine at its appointed time, and I will snatch away My wool and My linen for covering her nakedness.

12.verse: So now I will uncover her lewdness to the eyes of her lovers, and no one will rescue her from My hand.

13.verse: I will also put an end to all her rejoicing— her feasts, her New Moon, her Shabbat, and all her moadim.

14.verse: I will also devastate her vines and her fig trees, of which she said: ‘These are my payment that my lovers have given to me.’ But I will turn them into a thicket and beasts of the field will devour them.

15.verse: Then I will punish her for the days of the Baalim to whom she would burn incense— adorning herself with her rings and jewelry, going after her lovers— but Me she forgot.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

16.verse: Compassion and Covenant Love - “So then, I Myself will entice her, I will bring her into the wilderness and speak to her heart.

17.verse: I will give her back her vineyards from there and make the valley of Achor a door of hope. She will respond there— as in the days of her youth, as in the day she came up out of the land of Egypt.

18.verse: In that day—it is a declaration of ADONAI— you will proclaim, ‘My husband,’ and never again call Me, ‘My Baal.’

19.verse: Then I will remove the names of the Baalim out of her mouth, no longer to be mentioned by their name.

20.verse: In that day I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, the flying creatures in the sky, and the creeping things on the ground. I will break into pieces the bow and sword and warfare from the land, and I will cause them to lie down securely.

21.verse: Then I will betroth you to Me forever— yes, I will betroth you to Me with righteousness, justice, covenant loyalty and compassion.

22.verse: I will betroth you to Me with faithfulness, and you will know ADONAI.

23.verse: So it will be in that day, I will respond —it is a declaration of ADONAI— I will respond to the skies, and they will respond to the earth,

1.verse: Buying Back His Wife - Then ADONAI said to me: “Go again! Love a woman who is loved by a companion and committing adultery—just as ADONAI has loved the Bnei-Yisrael, while they were turning to other gods and loving raisin cakes.”

2.verse: So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver and an omer and a half of barley.

3.verse: Then I said to her: “For many days you must stay with me. You must not practice prostitution. You must not have a man, and I will be the same toward you.”

4.verse: For Bnei-Yisrael will remain for many days without king, without prince, without sacrifice, without sacred pillar, and without ephod or teraphim.

5.verse: Afterwards, Bnei-Yisrael will return, and they will seek ADONAI their God and David their king. Then they will turn in awe to ADONAI and to His goodness in the last days.

1.verse: Destroyed For Lack of Knowledge - Hear the word of ADONAI, Bnei-Yisrael! For ADONAI has a dispute with the inhabitants of the land, because there is no truth, no covenant loyalty, and no knowledge of God in the land.

2.verse: Curse, deceive, murder, steal, commit adultery! They practice violence, and bloodshed follows bloodshed.

3.verse: Therefore the land will mourn, and everyone dwelling in it will languish along with the beasts of the field and the flying creatures of the sky— even the fish of the sea will be removed.

4.verse: Yet let no one dispute and let no one argue. Your people are like a kohen who makes quarrels.

5.verse: So you will stumble by day. Also a prophet will stumble with you by night, when I destroy your mother.

6.verse: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Since you rejected knowledge, I will also reject you from being My kohen. Since you forgot the Torah of your God, just so I will forget your children.

7.verse: The more they multiplied, the more they sinned against Me. I will change their glory into disgrace.

8.verse: They feed on the sin of My people and relish their iniquity.

9.verse: But it will be like people, like kohen. So I will punish them for their ways, and repay them for their deeds.

10.verse: They have eaten but will not be satisfied. They have fornicated but will not increase. For they stopped giving heed to ADONAI.

11.verse: Prostitution and wine—even new wine— it takes away understanding.

12.verse: My people consult their wooden idol and their divining rod informs them. For a spirit of prostitution leads them astray and they have been a prostitute— out from under their God.

13.verse: They sacrifice on the mountaintops and on the high places they burn incense under oak poplar, and terebinth— for its shade is good. Therefore your daughters are prostitutes and your daughters-in-law commit adultery.

14.verse: Will I not punish your daughters for prostitution or your daughters-in-law for adultery? For they consort with prostitutes, and they sacrifice with cult prostitutes. A people without understanding will be thrust down.

15.verse: Though you, Israel, are a prostitute, let Judah not become guilty. But do not come to Gilgal or go up to Beth-aven, and do not swear: ‘As ADONAI lives!’

16.verse: For Israel is stubborn like a stubborn cow. Now ADONAI will pasture them like a lamb in the open field.

17.verse: Ephraim is joined to idols; let him alone!

18.verse: Their liquor has come to an end. They surely have practiced prostitution. Her rulers have deeply loved disgrace.

19.verse: A wind will wrap her up in its wings. They will be ashamed of their sacrifices.

1.verse: Judgment for Betrayal - Hear this, O priests! Pay attention, O house of Israel! Give ear, O house of the king! For the judgment applies to you: For you were a snare at Mizpah and a net spread on Tabor.

2.verse: Rebels were deep in slaughter, so I am a chastisement for them all.

3.verse: I myself have known Ephraim, and Israel is not hidden from Me. For now, Ephraim, you are a prostitute— Israel is defiled!

4.verse: They will not give up their evil deeds to return to their God. For a spirit of prostitution is in them, and ADONAI they have not known.

5.verse: The Pride of Israel will answer to his face: Israel and Ephraim will stagger in their iniquity, Judah also will stumble with them.

6.verse: With their flocks and with their herds they will go to seek ADONAI, but they will not find Him— He has withdrawn from them.

7.verse: They have betrayed ADONAI, for they have begotten foreign children. Now the New Moon will devour them, with their portions.

8.verse: Blow a shofar in Gibeah, a trumpet in Ramah! Sound an alarm at Beth-aven: “Behind you, Benjamin!”

9.verse: Ephraim will be become desolate in the day of rebuke. Among the tribes of Israel I made known what is certain.

10.verse: The princes of Judah were like those who move a boundary mark. I pour out My fury on them like water.

11.verse: Oppressed is Ephraim, crushed by judgment, for he willingly followed a worthless thing.

12.verse: So, I will be like a moth to Ephraim and like decay to the house of Judah.

13.verse: When Ephraim saw his sickness and Judah his wound, Ephraim went to Assyria and sent envoys to a warring king. But he cannot heal you nor will he cure your wound.

14.verse: For I will be like a lion to Ephraim, and like a young lion to the house of Judah. I, even I, will tear and go away. I will carry off, and nobody will rescue.

15.verse: I will go and return to My place until they admit their guilt. Then they will seek My face. In their distress they will seek Me earnestly:

1.verse: Prayer of Teshuvah - Come, let us return to ADONAI. For He has torn, but He will heal us. He has smitten, but He will bind us up.

2.verse: After two days He will revive us. On the third day He will raise us up, and we will live in His presence.

3.verse: So let us know, let us strive to know ADONAI. Like dawn His going forth is certain. He will come to us like the rain, like the latter rain watering the earth.

4.verse: Covenant Loyalty More Than Sacrifice - “O Ephraim, what shall I do for you? O Judah, what will I do for you? For your loyalty is like a morning cloud or like dew rising early, vanishing.

5.verse: Therefore I cut them down by the prophets. I slew them by the words of My mouth. Now the judgments pronounced against you: light will go forth.

6.verse: For I delight in loyalty and not sacrifice, knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.

7.verse: But like Adam, they transgressed a covenant. There they dealt treacherously with Me.

8.verse: Gilead is a city of evildoers, tracked with bloody footprints.

9.verse: Like marauding bands waiting for a man, so a company of priests murders on the way toward Shechem. For they have committed crime.

10.verse: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing: Ephraim’s prostitution is there, Israel has become unclean.

11.verse: Also, Judah, there is a harvest for you, when I return My people from captivity.”

1.verse: Iniquity of Senseless Ephraim - “When I would have healed Israel, the iniquity of Ephraim was uncovered, even the wickedness of Samaria, for they practice fraud. So a thief breaks in; a marauding band will raid outside.

2.verse: But they never admit in their heart that I remember all their evil. Now their deeds are all around them. They are right before My face.

3.verse: They gladden the king with their evil and the princes with their lies.

4.verse: All of them are practicing adultery, as an oven heated by a baker who stops stirring or kneading dough when it is leavened.

5.verse: On the day of our king, princes become sick from wine. His hand drags scorners along.

6.verse: For their hearts are like an oven, as they wait in ambush. All night their anger smolders. In the morning it burns like a blazing fire.

7.verse: All of them are hot like an oven, and they devour their rulers. All of their kings have fallen. None among them calls on Me.

8.verse: Ephraim mixes himself with the peoples. Ephraim has become a pancake that never gets turned over.

9.verse: Strangers devoured his strength— yet he does not know it. Gray hairs have spread on him— and he does not know it.

10.verse: Though the Pride of Israel has answered him to his face, yet they did not return to ADONAI their God, nor seek Him about all this.

11.verse: Ephraim is like a senseless silly dove, they call to Egypt; they go to Assyria.

12.verse: As they are going, I will spread out My net over them, I will bring them down like a bird from the sky. I will chasten them as in the report that comes to their assembly.

13.verse: Oy to them! For they strayed from Me. Devastation to them! For they rebelled against Me. Should I redeem them after they spoke lies about Me?

14.verse: Nor did they not cry to Me in their heart when they were wailing on their beds. For the sake of grain and new wine they slash themselves— they keep turning away from Me.

15.verse: I trained and strengthened their arms, yet they kept planning evil against Me.

16.verse: They will turn back—only not upwards. They are like a treacherous bow. Their princes will fall by the sword because of the insolence with their tongues. This will be for their ridicule in the land of Egypt.

1.verse: Idols Thrown Down - “Put a shofar to your mouth! Like a vulture he comes against the house of ADONAI. For they overstepped My covenant and transgressed My Torah.

2.verse: Will they cry out to Me, ‘My God, we—Israel—knew You’?

3.verse: Israel has rejected goodness— an adversary will pursue him.

4.verse: They crowned kings, but not by Me. They appointed princes I did not approve. Their silver and gold they made into idols— just so they would be cut down.

5.verse: Samaria! Your calf is thrown down! My anger is kindled against them! How long will they be incapable of innocence?

6.verse: For a craftsman from Israel made it, so it is no god. For the calf of Samaria will be splinters.

7.verse: “For they sow wind, and reap a whirlwind. There is no mature grain— the sprout yields no meal. Should it produce anything, strangers would swallow it up.

8.verse: Israel has been swallowed up! Now they are among the nations, like an ornament with no delight in it.

9.verse: For they have gone up to Assyria, like a wild donkey alone by itself. Ephraim has hired lovers.

10.verse: Although they hire among the nations, I will now round them up. So they will begin to decrease under the burden of king and princes.

11.verse: “When Ephraim multiplied altars for making sin offerings, they became his altars for sinning.

12.verse: Though I were to write out for him ten thousand things from My Torah, they are regarded as something strange.

13.verse: Sacrifices are gifts for Me— should they sacrifice meat and then eat it? ADONAI will not accept them. Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sin— they will return to Egypt.

14.verse: For Israel has forgotten his Maker and built temples, while Judah has multiplied fortified cities. So I will send fire upon its cities that will consume their citadels.”

1.verse: Days of Desolation Are Coming - Do not rejoice, O Israel, do not celebrate like the peoples— for so you have gone whoring away from your God. You have loved a prostitute’s pay, on every grain-threshing-floor.

2.verse: Threshing-floor and wine-press will not sustain them, and new wine will fail her.

3.verse: They will not dwell in ADONAI’s land. Instead Ephraim will return to Egypt, and eat unclean food in Assyria.

4.verse: They will pour no wine-offerings to ADONAI— they would not be pleasing to Him. Their sacrifices will be like the bread of mourners for them. All that eat it will be defiled, for their bread is for their appetite, not coming into the House of ADONAI.

5.verse: What will you do for a moed or for the day of ADONAI’s feast?

6.verse: Look, even if they escape the desolation, Egypt will gather them up; Memphis will bury them. And their precious silver treasures? Weeds will possess them. Thorns will be in their tents.

7.verse: The days of punishment have come; the days of retribution have come. Let Israel know! The prophet is a fool; the man of the spirit is mad! For great is your iniquity and great the hostility.

8.verse: Ephraim is a watchman with my God, a prophet. A bird catcher’s trap is on all his paths. Hostility is in the House of his God.

9.verse: They have deeply corrupted themselves as in the days of Gibeah. He will remember their iniquity, He will punish their sin.

10.verse: “Like grapes in the wilderness I found Israel. Like early fruit on a fig tree in its first season I saw your fathers. They came to Baal-peor and devoted themselves to shame. So they became as detestable as the thing they loved.

11.verse: Ephraim’s glory flies away like a bird— no birth, no pregnancy, no conception!

12.verse: For if they should raise their children, I would make them childless to the last man. Yes, woe to them when I depart from them!

13.verse: Ephraim, as I have seen, is like Tyre, planted in a meadow, but Ephraim will bring his children out to the slayer.”

14.verse: Give them, ADONAI, what will You give? Give them a miscarrying womb and dried up breasts.

15.verse: “All their wickedness is at Gilgal, for there I despised them. Because of their wicked practices, I will drive them out of My House. I will love them no more. All their princes are rebellious.

16.verse: Ephraim is blighted; their root is withered; they bear no fruit. Even if they bring forth children, I will slay the cherished ones in their wombs.”

17.verse: My God will cast them off, since they did not listen to Him. So they will become wanderers among the nations.

1.verse: Israel to be Shamed in Captivity - A luxuriant vine is Israel, who produces fruit for himself. Like the abundance of his fruit he has multiplied his altars. Like the goodness of his land, they made beautiful sacred pillars.

2.verse: Their heart became smooth. Now they will bear their guilt. He will break down their altars. He will destroy their sacred pillars.

3.verse: Surely now they will say: “We have no king, for we have not feared ADONAI. The king—what can he do for us?”

4.verse: They spoke words— empty oaths to make a covenant. But judgment springs up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.

5.verse: The inhabitants of Samaria will quarrel over the calves of Beth-aven. Indeed its people will mourn over it, but its priests will tremble over it. For its glory will surely depart from it.

6.verse: It also will be carried to Assyria as tribute to a warring king. Ephraim will receive shame and Israel will be put to shame by its own counsel.

7.verse: Samaria is being cut off. Her king is like a splinter on the surface of the water.

8.verse: The high places of Aven, the sin of Israel will be destroyed. Thorns and thistles will come up on their altars. And they will say to the mountains: “Cover us!” And to the hills: “Fall on us!”

9.verse: “From the days of Gibeah, you have sinned, O Israel. There they took their stand. Will not war over sons of iniquity overtake them in Gibeah?

10.verse: When I desire, I will chasten them, and peoples will gather against them when they are yoked to their two sins.

11.verse: Though Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh, I put a yoke over her fair neck. I will make Ephraim pull; Judah will plow; Jacob will drag a harrow by himself.”

12.verse: Plow Up Your Ground - Sow for yourselves righteousness. Reap in accord with covenant love. Break up your unplowed ground. For it is time to seek ADONAI, until He comes and showers righteousness on you.

13.verse: You have plowed up wickedness, you have reaped iniquity. You have eaten the fruit of delusion, for you have trusted in your own way, in the multitude of your mighty men.

14.verse: A tumult will arise among your people. All your strongholds will be demolished, as Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel in the day of battle, when a mother was dashed in pieces with her children.

15.verse: Just so has Bethel done to you because of your great wickedness. At dawn the king of Israel will be utterly cut off.

1.verse: My Son Called Out - “When Israel was a youth I loved him, and out of Egypt I called My son.

2.verse: They called out to them but they departed from their presence. They kept sacrificing to the Baalim and burning incense up to idols.

3.verse: Yet it was I who taught Ephraim to walk. I took them on My arms. But they never acknowledged that I had healed them.

4.verse: With human cords I was drawing them, with bonds of love, and I became to them as One lifting a yoke from their jaws. I bent down to them and fed them.

5.verse: He will not return to the land of Egypt, but the Assyrian will be his king— because they refused to return.

6.verse: So a sword will fall on his cities, and destroy and devour his gate bars because of their own counsels.

7.verse: So My people are bent on turning from Me. Although they are being called upwards, none will rise up.

8.verse: “How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I surrender you, Israel? How can I make you like Admah? How can I set you as Zeboim? My heart is turning over within Me. My compassions are kindled.

9.verse: I will not vent My fierce anger. I will not again destroy Ephraim. For I am God—not a man— the Holy One in the midst of you, and I will not come in fury.”

10.verse: They will walk after ADONAI. He will roar like a lion. Indeed, He will roar and the children will come trembling from the west.

11.verse: “They will come trembling like a bird out of Egypt, like a dove out of the land of Assyria, and I will settle them in their houses.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

4.verse: In the womb he grasped his brother’s heel, and in his vigor he strove with God.

5.verse: Yes, he wrestled with the angel and won; he wept and sought his favor. At Bethel he will find us, and there He will speak with us.

6.verse: Even ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot— ADONAI is His memorial-Name.

7.verse: So you should return to your God, keep covenant loyalty and justice, and wait for your God continually.

8.verse: A merchant loves to extort, with deceptive balances in his hand.

9.verse: Now Ephraim has said: “How rich I have become! I found wealth by myself. I won’t be guilty of any sin with any of my property.”

10.verse: “Yet I have been ADONAI your God, since the land of Egypt. I will yet again make you dwell in tents, as in the days of the moed.

11.verse: I also spoke through the prophets and I multiplied visions. Now through the prophets I will make parables.

12.verse: Since Gilead is full of iniquity, they are utterly worthless. In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls— even their altars will become heaps of rocks along the furrows of My field.”

13.verse: Now Jacob fled to the field of Aram, when Israel served for a wife— yes, he kept watch for a wife.

14.verse: So by a prophet ADONAI brought Israel up out of Egypt, and by a prophet he was kept.

1.verse: No Other Savior - When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling. He exalted himself in Israel, but he became guilty through Baal, and died.

2.verse: But now, they sin more and more. They made themselves molten images, idols skillfully made from their silver, all of them the work of the craftsmen. They say about them: “Let those who sacrifice kiss the calves.”

3.verse: Therefore they will be like morning clouds, like dew passing away early, like chaff blown from the threshing-floor, or like smoke from a chimney.

4.verse: “Yet I have been ADONAI your God since the land of Egypt. You should know no God but Me, and there is no Savior apart from Me.

5.verse: I Myself knew you in the wilderness, in a land of terrible drought.

6.verse: While they were fed, they were satisfied. Filled, their hearts became haughty. Therefore they forgot Me.

7.verse: So I became like a lion to them— like a leopard lying in wait by the way.

8.verse: I will meet them like a bear robbed of her cubs, and I will tear open their chests. There I will devour them like a lioness. A beast of the field will rip them to shreds.

9.verse: It has corrupted you, O Israel, for you are against Me—against your Helper!

10.verse: Where then is your king? So, will he save you in all your cities? Or your judges, to whom you said: ‘Give me a king and princes!’

11.verse: I give you a king in My anger, and take him away in My wrath.

12.verse: Ephraim is bound by iniquity; his sin is treasured up.

13.verse: Pains of birth come on him. He is not a wise son. When the time comes, he should not delay at the opening of the womb.

14.verse: Should I ransom them from the hand of Sheol? Should I redeem them from death? O death, where are your plagues? O Sheol, where is your sting? Comfort is hidden from My eyes.”

15.verse: Because he is the son of kinsmen, he should have been fruitful. An east wind will come—the wind from ADONAI, coming up from the wilderness. His spring will become dry, and his fountain will dry up. He will plunder the treasury of every precious vessel.

4.verse: ‘Assyria will not save us. We will not ride on horses, and we will never again say, “Our god,” to the work of our hands, for with You, orphans find mercy.’”
